title: Settings wIndow does not open (and images can not be dropped on the timeline) for non-English languages

sentences.text: I just install new version of openshot (1.4.1), and "setting" window does not open !!!
What locale setting do you use?
This is now fixed in the trunk.
I try to reinstall openshot 1.4.1 and now he does not want to open !!!!
I'm using using Ubuntu 11.04 - the Natty Narwhal, and this is what the terminal me Raport
------------------------- ERROR 1 ------------------------------ Failed to import 'from openshot import main'
Error Message: cannot import name main
------------------------- ERROR 2 ------------------------------ Failed to import 'from openshot.openshot import main'
Error Message: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'xid'
OpenShot has failed to import some of the Python files or libraries  required for our application to run.
Here are some trouble shooting tips:
Tip 1) Check if MLT can be successfully imported in Python.
Run the   following commands, and see if any errors are displayed.
If you get   an error, you need to investigate the correct way to install MLT.
NOTE:  Do not type the $ or >> characters in the examples below.
Tip 2) If MLT is working from the first example, then the next tip is   to look at the above error messages very closely, and google for more   help.
It's likely the problem is already reported, and maybe there is  a simple work-around.
Also, you can search for bugs or report a new   bug at https://bugs.launchpad.net/openshot.
It seems this is a different bug (object has no attribute 'xid').
The original bug (settings window not opening in non-English locales) has been fixed.
Let's open a different bug report for this.
For having the last version (with the fix) you must pass by the daily ppa.
See here how to do this operation : https://answers.launchpad.net/openshot/+faq/1850 Think to desactivate the "official" before using the second.
Thank you very much for your help,
Jonathan excuse me, I am rather user  forum and not sites "bug report"  :-)
Especially, I think my last problem is come from my  setup :-(
Thank and good luck for openshot.
Just a comment for anyone still getting an error trying to drop an image on the timeline.
To fix your settings file (which might have been messed up from version 1.4.1), just open up the Preferences window, and then close it.
That will update your settings file with the correctly formatted "Default Image Length" setting, and now images can be successfully dropped on your timeline.
